title: Hampstead Heath: How the 'lungs of the metropolis' remained unblackened
description: If a Victorian-era landowner hadn't been thwarted, Hampstead Heath as we know it might not exist.

title: Turkey's plastics ban: Where does the UK send its waste now?
description: Turkey is due to ban most plastic waste sent from the UK, so tonnes of packaging will need a new home.

title: Fear Street and Goosebumps author RL Stine: 'I find horror very funny'
description: He says it was a "shock" seeing Fear Street being adapted for a grown-up audience on Netflix.

title: A Cambodian village ripped apart by a bad batch of rice wine
description: At least 30 Cambodians died recently in less than a month after drinking toxic home-brewed alcohol.

title: Parents of children called Alexa challenge Amazon
description: Youngsters are being bullied over their name - also the default wake word for the tech firm's smart speakers.

title: 'Coercion and rape': Investigating my yoga school
description: Ishleen Kaur was passionate about yoga movement Sivananda, until she found allegations of sexual abuse.

title: Lebanon’s ‘suffocating’ energy crisis
description: Six-year-old Sedra is one of the people whose lives have been put at risk by the country's energy crisis.

title: Personal Independence Payments: 'Have I less than six months to live?'
description: The government is accused of creating a 'two tier welfare system' for people who have terminal illnesses by two charities.

title: How airlines will stop you losing your bags in the future
description: In 2019, 25.4 million bags went missing, costing the industry billions of dollars - can big data solve the problem?

title: Vaccine hesitancy: Your job or the jab?
description: Health workers once on the frontline of the pandemic are now embroiled in a row over vaccine mandates.

title: Diamond League: Norway’s ‘superhero’ Warholm breaks 400m hurdles world record
description: Norway's Karsten Warholm runs 46.70 to set a new world record in the 400m hurdles in front of his home crowd at the Diamond League meeting in Oslo.

title: Wimbledon 2021: Emma Raducanu beats Marketa Vondrousova - best shots
description: Watch the best shots as 18-year-old British wildcard Emma Raducanu beats Marketa Vondrousova to reach the third round of Wimbledon.

title: Wimbledon 2021: Roger Federer, Coco Gauff and Daniil Medvedev in day four best bits
description: Watch some of the best bits from day four at Wimbledon including an incredible shot by Coco Gauff and a pocket mishap on court two.

title: Pride Month: Labour MP Dan Carden on alcohol addiction
description: An MP gives an emotional speech on his family's support as he battled his alcohol addiction.

title: Nissan announces major UK electric car expansion
description: The carmaker will build its new all-electric model in Sunderland, alongside a massive electric battery plant.

title: Covid: Boris Johnson upbeat about easing lockdown in England on 19 July
description: Boris Johnson hopes England will return to as close to the "status quo" as possible on 19 July.

title: Ollie Bibby: Hospital apologises to mum unable to visit dying son
description: Ollie Bibby's family say they are happy that visiting restrictions will be reviewed.

title: Wimbledon 2021: Fourth seed Alexander Zverev beats Tennys Sandgren to reach third round
description: German fourth seed Alexander Zverev reaches the third round at Wimbledon with a straight-set victory over American Tennys Sandgren on day four.

title: Wimbledon 2021: Heather Watson and Harriet Dart win doubles opener
description: British pair Heather Watson and Harriet Dart produce a commanding display to beat Kaia Kanepi and Zhang Shuai at Wimbledon.

title: Covid: Misleading stat claims more vaccinated people die
description: Vaccines reduce the risk of death but do not eliminate it completely.

title: Los Angeles fireworks explosion: Truck goes up in flames as police seize fireworks
description: A truck filled with 2,000kg of fireworks goes up in flames, injuring at least 17 people in Los Angeles.

title: Covid: UK's furlough scheme starts to wind down
description: Employers will start paying part of workers' furlough wages as the job support scheme is withdrawn.

title: Trump Organization indicted in tax probe, US media report
description: The finance chief of the ex-president's firm surrenders ahead of the expected unsealing of charges.

title: Dennis the Menace: Royal Mail stamps mark 70 years of Beano character
description: Royal Mail says the Beano bad boy has entertained generations with his "mischief and mayhem".

title: Can government ministers use private emails for official work?
description: Ex-Health Secretary Matt Hancock and others face criticism over using personal accounts for official business.

title: Britney Spears: Judge denies request to remove father from conservatorship
description: A judge denies the star's request to remove her father from his role overseeing her conservatorship.

title: William and Harry to unveil Diana statue at Kensington Palace
description: It will be unveiled at Diana's former home, Kensington Palace, on what would have been her 60th birthday.

title: US-Canada heatwave: Visual guide to the causes
description: Maps, graphics and charts explaining the Canada and north-west US heatwave, with temperatures at nearly 50C.

title: Bill Cosby: Accusers speak of shock and anger after conviction overturned
description: Women who have accused the US comedian of sexual assault have been speaking out after his release.

title: High-profile women want action to stop online abuse

title: Hogg to captain Lions in South Africa tour opener
description: Scotland's Stuart Hogg captains a new-look British and Irish Lions XV in their tour opener against the Emirates Lions in Johannesburg on Saturday.

title: Rare white puffin spotted on Scottish island
description: The young puffin, spotted on Handa Island, has a lack of pigmentation caused by a genetic condition called leucism.

title: Man apologises for accosting Prof Chris Whitty in park
description: Police are investigating a video which shows two men grabbing hold of England's chief medical officer.

title: Cillian Murphy is sorry for everything in poignant post-apocalyptic film
description: All of This Unreal Time, which premieres in Manchester this week, charts a man's existential journey.

title: The Easter Island pianist playing for her home's future

title: Covid common in cats and dogs, study finds
description: Pet owners with Covid could infect about 20% of cats and dogs, although most symptoms are mild.
